pyfunc.pipeline module¶

class pyfunc.pipeline.Pipeline(initial_value: Any = None, _pipeline_func: Callable[[Any], Any] | None = None)[source]¶

Bases: Generic[T]

A chainable functional pipeline for transforming values or iterables. Supports chaining, conditional application, operator overloading, and more.

add(number: Any) → Pipeline[Any][source]¶

Add a number to the current value.

apply(func: Callable[[Any], U]) → Pipeline[U][source]¶

Apply func to the value (or map over iterable). Chainable.

apply_if(condition: Callable[[Any], bool], func: Callable[[Any], Any]) → Pipeline[Any][source]¶

Apply func to the entire value if condition is True (or condition(self.value) is True if callable).

assert_(predicate: Callable[[Any], bool], message: str = 'Assertion failed') → Pipeline[T][source]¶

Throw an error if the predicate fails.

chain(*others: Iterable[Any]) → Pipeline[Generator[Any, None, None]][source]¶

Concatenate multiple sequences.

chunk(size: int) → Pipeline[Generator[list[T], None, None]][source]¶

Break a sequence into chunks of the given size.

clone() → Pipeline[T][source]¶

Return a new Pipeline with the same initial value and accumulated function.

combinations(r: int) → Pipeline[Generator[tuple[Any, ...], None, None]][source]¶

Return r-length subsequences of elements from the input iterable.

compose(*funcs: Callable[[Any], Any]) → Pipeline[Any][source]¶

Compose multiple functions and apply them as a single transformation.

count() → Pipeline[int][source]¶

Count the number of elements in an iterable.

debug() → Pipeline[T][source]¶

Prints the current value of the pipeline for debugging purposes.

do(func: Callable[[Any], Any]) → Pipeline[T][source]¶

Alias for tap method for explicit side effects.

explode(delimiter: str) → Pipeline[list[str]][source]¶

Split a string by the given delimiter.

classmethod extend(name: str, func: Callable[[...], Any]) → None[source]¶

Extend the Pipeline class with a new method.

filter(predicate: Callable[[Any], bool]) → Pipeline[Generator[T, None, None]][source]¶

Filter elements of an iterable based on a predicate.

first() → Pipeline[T | None][source]¶

Get the first element of an iterable.

flatten() → Pipeline[Generator[Any, None, None]][source]¶

Flatten one level of nested iterables.

flatten_deep() → Pipeline[Generator[Any, None, None]][source]¶

Recursively flatten nested iterables.

classmethod from_iterable(iterable: Iterable[T]) → Pipeline[Generator[T, None, None]][source]¶

Create a Pipeline from any iterable (tuple, set, generator, etc).

get() → Any[source]¶

Get the current value from the pipeline by applying all accumulated functions.

group_by(key: Callable[[Any], Any]) → Pipeline[dict[Any, list[T]]][source]¶

Group elements of an iterable based on a key function.

if_else(pred: Callable[[Any], bool], then_fn: Callable[[Any], Any], else_fn: Callable[[Any], Any]) → Pipeline[Any][source]¶

Apply then_fn if pred(value) is True, otherwise apply else_fn.

implode(delimiter: str) → Pipeline[str][source]¶

Join a list of strings with the given delimiter.

is_empty() → Pipeline[bool][source]¶

Check if the iterable is empty.

last() → Pipeline[T | None][source]¶

Get the last element of an iterable.

map(func: Callable[[Any], U]) → Pipeline[Generator[U, None, None]][source]¶

Alias for apply method to map a function over elements.

map_values(func: Callable[[Any], U]) → Pipeline[dict[Any, U]][source]¶

Apply a function to the values of a dictionary.

max() → Pipeline[T | None][source]¶

Get the maximum element in an iterable.

min() → Pipeline[T | None][source]¶

Get the minimum element in an iterable.

nth(n: int) → Pipeline[T | None][source]¶

Get the nth element of an iterable (0-indexed).

pairwise() → Pipeline[Generator[tuple[Any, Any], None, None]][source]¶

Group elements of a list into pairs as tuples.

pipe(*funcs: Callable[[Any], Any]) → Pipeline[Any][source]¶

Applies a sequence of functions to the current value in order.

product(*iterables: Iterable[Any]) → Pipeline[Generator[tuple[Any, ...], None, None]][source]¶

Cartesian product of input iterables.

reduce(func: Callable[[Any, Any], U], initializer: Any | None = None) → Pipeline[U][source]¶

Apply a function of two arguments cumulatively to the items of an iterable, from left to right, to reduce the iterable to a single value.

reduce_right(func: Callable[[Any, Any], U], initializer: Any | None = None) → Pipeline[U][source]¶

Apply a function of two arguments cumulatively to the items of an iterable, from right to left, to reduce the iterable to a single value.

classmethod register_custom_type(custom_type: type, handlers: dict[str, Callable[[Any], Any]]) → None[source]¶

Register custom type handlers for specific operations.

reverse() → Pipeline[list[T]][source]¶

Reverse the order of elements in an iterable.

skip(n: int) → Pipeline[Generator[T, None, None]][source]¶

Skip the first n elements from the iterable.

skip_while(predicate: Callable[[Any], bool]) → Pipeline[Generator[T, None, None]][source]¶

Skip elements from the iterable as long as the predicate is true.

sliding_pairs() → Pipeline[Generator[list[T], None, None]][source]¶

Create a sliding window of pairs over a sequence.

sliding_reduce(func: Callable[[Any], U], size: int) → Pipeline[Generator[U, None, None]][source]¶

Create sliding windows and apply a function to each.

sort(key: Callable[[Any], Any] | None = None, reverse: bool = False) → Pipeline[list[T]][source]¶

Sort the iterable.

starmap(func: Callable[[...], U]) → Pipeline[Generator[U, None, None]][source]¶

Apply a function to each tuple in a list of tuples.

subtract(number: Any) → Pipeline[Any][source]¶

Subtract a number from the current value.

sum() → Pipeline[int | float][source]¶

Calculate the sum of elements in an iterable.

surround(prefix: str, suffix: str) → Pipeline[str][source]¶

Wrap the string with a prefix and suffix.

take(n: int) → Pipeline[Generator[T, None, None]][source]¶

Take the first n elements from the iterable.

take_while(predicate: Callable[[Any], bool]) → Pipeline[Generator[T, None, None]][source]¶

Take elements from the iterable as long as the predicate is true.

tap(func: Callable[[Any], Any]) → Pipeline[T][source]¶

Run func(self.value) for side effects, do not change value.

tee() → tuple[Pipeline[T], Pipeline[T]][source]¶

Duplicate the current pipeline into two independent pipelines.

template_fill(data: dict[str, Any]) → Pipeline[str][source]¶

Apply string templating from a key-value map.

then(func: Callable[[Any], U]) → Pipeline[U][source]¶

Alias for apply method for chaining operations.

to_list() → list[Any][source]¶

Force evaluation of the pipeline and return the result as a list.

trace(label: str) → Pipeline[T][source]¶

Prints the current value of the pipeline with a custom label for tracing.

unique() → Pipeline[Generator[T, None, None]][source]¶

Remove duplicates from the iterable while preserving order.

unless(pred: Callable[[Any], bool], func: Callable[[Any], Any]) → Pipeline[Any][source]¶

Apply func only if pred(value) is False.

when(pred: Callable[[Any], bool], func: Callable[[Any], Any]) → Pipeline[Any][source]¶

Apply func only if pred(value) is True.

window(size: int, step: int = 1) → Pipeline[Generator[list[T], None, None]][source]¶

Create a sliding window view over a sequence.

with_items() → Pipeline[Generator[tuple[Any, Any], None, None]][source]¶

Convert a dictionary into a list of key-value pairs.

zip_with(other: Iterable[Any]) → Pipeline[Generator[tuple[Any, Any], None, None]][source]¶

Zip the current iterable with another iterable.

pyfunc.pipeline.pipe(value: T) → Pipeline[T][source]¶

Creates a new Pipeline instance with the given initial value.

pyfunc.pipeline.pipeline(func: Callable[[Pipeline[Any]], Pipeline[Any]]) → Callable[[Any], Pipeline[Any]][source]¶

Decorator to create a pipeline from a function.
